summary: An email dated August 7, 2019, containing U.S. Customs and Border Protection records of Jeffrey Epstein's recent flights to and from St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands, in the months prior to his arrest. The email is sent from an NYPD detective on an FBI task force.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The document lists recent flight records for Jeffrey Epstein showing travel between St. Thomas and Teterboro/West Palm Beach in 2019.

events.title: Epstein flight from St Thomas to Teterboro
events.description: Flight recorded by U.S. Customs and Border Protection from St. Thomas to Teterboro.

events.title: Epstein flight from St Thomas to West Palm Beach
events.description: Flight recorded by U.S. Customs and Border Protection from St. Thomas to West Palm Beach.

events.title: Epstein flight from St Thomas to Teterboro
events.description: Flight recorded by U.S. Customs and Border Protection from St. Thomas to Teterboro.

events.title: Epstein flight from St. Thomas to West Palm Beach
events.description: Flight recorded by U.S. Customs and Border Protection from St. Thomas to West Palm Beach.

keyFacts: U.S. Customs and Border Protection records show Jeffrey Epstein made multiple flights from St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands, to Teterboro, New Jersey, and West Palm Beach, Florida, between April and June 2019.
The records were shared via email on August 7, 2019, shortly after Epstein's arrest in July 2019.
The email sender is identified as an NYPD detective assigned to the FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force, indicating law enforcement interest in Epstein's travel patterns.
The flights demonstrate Epstein's continued international mobility and use of private air travel in the months leading up to his arrest.
